Good morning folks, 

I would like to welcome @U09UKDH3AA0 to the team as he would be joining us as a Staff Product Manager supporting The Pets Table. Prateek will be working together with the existing tech and commercial team, further growing our pet food service offering to customers across the US.

Please feel free to reach out to Prateek and give a warm welcome to HelloFresh!

messages.text:
Both GoodChop and ThePetsTable recently noticed that there is a funky case. I'll put an example from GoodChop, but the same is observed for TPT.
• Customer goes to "plan change" flow (any flow that is related to changing subscription SKU). For example,  changing from "6 cuts" to "8 cuts".
• We patch the subscription SKU, but all the upcoming deliveries stay the same ("6 cuts") because of customer recurring selection that ensures the same selection (including the seamless size change) for all the upcoming boxes.
• In theory, we should submit a new meal selection (also with a new SKU) to set a new source of truth for recurring selection, but we only have 6 out of 8 cuts selected.
The question to product folks - how this should work from customer perspective?
messages.raw_text:
Both GoodChop and ThePetsTable recently noticed that there is a funky case. I'll put an example from GoodChop, but the same is observed for TPT.
• Customer goes to "plan change" flow (any flow that is related to changing subscription SKU). For example,  changing from "6 cuts" to "8 cuts".
• We patch the subscription SKU, but all the upcoming deliveries stay the same ("6 cuts") because of customer recurring selection that ensures the same selection (including the seamless size change) for all the upcoming boxes.
• In theory, we should submit a new meal selection (also with a new SKU) to set a new source of truth for recurring selection, but we only have 6 out of 8 cuts selected.
The question to product folks - how this should work from customer perspective?

thread_replies.text:
As I was in Good Chop when this feature was designed, I say what product thought back then:

Whenever a customer is changing a both size, we want to ask them to do a meal selection. So we would always redirect them somehow to a new meal selection

In TPT's case this is when user's change cadence (for TPT cadence also includes box size) and I'm not sure it would make lot of sense UX wise to make users reselect their meals when updating cadence. We'll likely just have to make another meal swap request whenever users update cadence :confused:

> We’ll likely just have to make another meal swap request whenever users update cadence
This was our suggestion when TPT was onboarded in KRS this year. I could be wrong, but I think this was already implemented
No we don't currently make a meal swap request after changing the cadence

For TPT:
• we direct the user to meal selection if they change their plan 
• For changing cadence the recipe selection is still valid
Why would we need to make it?

> • we direct the user to meal selection if they change their plan
That’s perfect

> • For changing cadence the recipe selection is still valid
When changing the cadence, the sku also changes, correct? Then unfortunately the selection needs to be redone as well, as in the HF systems a selection is connected with an SKU.
However this can happen behind the scenes, so no need to redirect a customer to do a new selection, all you need to do is a call to `/carts` once again with the new sku

Confirming that we noticed this behaviour on MR lately where it doesn't correctly update customers to the correct number of cuts  (https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3416)

We haven't picked up the ticket properly yet so it's unclear if this incorrect behaviour was always there

I agree that ideally if someone changes Plan, we give confirmation that this worked and direct them to meal selection. For cadence no direction to meal selection is necessary - it should just persist the previous selection and this works as expected today
@UE4HG114J are you investigating this bug?
Well, let's say I investigated it, and the summary is above - it is claimed to be an expected behavior and not a bug :dunno:
So to "fix" it, we need to implement a different customer experience (eg. direct to meal selection)

I thought previously what would happen is that it wouldn't lead someone to meal selection but if they go back to Dashboard it would update to the correct number of cuts but set the recipes to default recipes until somebody enters meal selection
But before Bolo left he mentioned it didn't look like any potentially related files were changed recently -- did you find the same?

Yes, I was assisting Bolo on that investigation, and we figured out that the deliveries' SKUs are not changed when subscription one is.
I tried to understand why, and it led me to customer recurring selection. As per Vini, the service always worked like that, so either we changed customer experience recently (and as per Bolo, we didn't), or it was always like that.
ok clear - thanks for confirming
will treat this as a separate initiative then

messages.text:
As mentioned in tribe standup, this upcoming Sprint we'll investigate how to optimize our https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/result/dDJT8riV4Xc on the https://www.goodchop.com/first-box/MR-CBT1-12-1-0 from 300-500 ms closer to 600-700 ms currently. Select Cuts is where customers perform pre-checkout cut selection

Likely it's related to the rollout of the new product cards, however we don't wish to roll this back so we will need to find other ways to optimize. If anyone can share any ideas that would be helpful!
messages.raw_text:
As mentioned in tribe standup, this upcoming Sprint we'll investigate how to optimize our <https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/result/dDJT8riV4Xc|increasing INP> on the <https://www.goodchop.com/first-box/MR-CBT1-12-1-0|Select Cuts page> from 300-500 ms closer to 600-700 ms currently. Select Cuts is where customers perform pre-checkout cut selection

Likely it's related to the rollout of the new product cards, however we don't wish to roll this back so we will need to find other ways to optimize. If anyone can share any ideas that would be helpful!

Hey Team,
It was a pleasure working with everyone in the tribe for more than 3.5 years. Let's count this as a longer vacation, I would love to connect and work with you all in the future. Feel free to ping me if you want to grab coffee/lunch/dinner or even play football with me in Berlin on Sundays, or maybe Fifa (we can make some arrangements :P). Until then, Auf Wiedersehen und bis später  (not sure if I used that right, entschuldigung then)
Contact/WhatsApp No: +49 17615681402
Hit me up on https://linkedin.com/in/shujathkhan and would be great if you could drop me a recommendation (i can do the same. Also, let's connect on instagram as well @shujath_khan.
